key_title: Key to the species of Tetragonia

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Dicotyledons
Key to the genera of Aizoaceae

source.author: Walsh, N.G.
source.title: Aizoaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae
source.citation: Modified from: Walsh, N.G. (1996). Aizoaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Annual herbs with rather short, prostrate branches; flowers green, sessile or subsessile
Perennial subshrub with long-trailing or climbing branches; flowers yellow, pedicellate; pedicels at least 5 mm long
Stamens 10–16; fruit 10 mm long or more; coastal or near-coastal
Fruits with incurved claw-like projections, lacking wings; styles and locules 8–13; stamens 4–8; restricted to floodplains in the north-west
Fruits without incurved claw-like projections or winged with horn-like projections; styles and locules 2–8; stamens 4
Styles and locules 3–8; fruit prominently winged (usually 2 large and 2 smaller wings) with intervening ribs; 5–7 mm long and usually wider than long; northwestern
Styles and locules 2–3; fruit not winged, sometimes ribbed on angles; 4–5 mm long, never wider than long; eastern
Flowers solitary or paired; fruit succulent
Flowers in clusters of 3–5; fruit dry
Leaves non-succulent, narrow-obovate to narrow-elliptic; flowers spicate on ± erect branches
